summary: An in-depth interview with Daniel Ellsberg discussing topics like whistleblowing, surveillance state, and government accountability.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a black screen displaying the text "An Interview with Daniel Ellsberg 1984 Day, San Francisco" in blue and white letters, setting the context for the interview. It then transitions to another black screen with the text "Interviewer Vahid Razavi, BizCloud®" in white and blue letters, identifying the interviewer. The scene shifts to an outdoor setting where an older man with white hair, wearing a blue shirt, is being interviewed by a man with dark hair and glasses. The interviewer holds a digital recorder, and a woman with blonde hair, wearing headphones and sunglasses, is seen holding a microphone and a smartphone, possibly recording the interview. The background shows a busy urban park with people walking, sitting, and engaging in various activities, with trees and buildings visible in the distance. The atmosphere is lively and bustling, with the interview taking place amidst the vibrant city life. The video continues with the same interview scene, where the older man, identified as Daniel Ellsberg, a former military analyst, author, and activist, is speaking. The interviewer and the woman with headphones and sunglasses are still present, and the background remains consistent with the busy urban park setting. The text "Daniel Ellsberg Former Military Analyst, Author, and Activist" appears on the screen, providing context about the interviewee. The video maintains a dynamic and engaging atmosphere, capturing the essence of the interview within the lively urban environment.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with electronic music playing in the background. The music is rhythmic, with synthesizer-like sounds creating a sense of tension or urgency. A man begins speaking, discussing the role of defense contractors in the surveillance state, mentioning specific corporations and people. The music continues softly underneath the speech.

events_list.video_caption: In a bustling urban park, Daniel Ellsberg, a former military analyst, author, and activist, is being interviewed by a reporter. Ellsberg, dressed in a blue shirt, speaks animatedly while the reporter, wearing sunglasses and holding a microphone, listens attentively. A woman with headphones and a microphone is also present, possibly recording the interview. The background is filled with people walking, sitting, and enjoying the sunny day, with tall buildings and trees framing the lively scene. The text overlay identifies Ellsberg and his credentials, providing context to the interview. The atmosphere is vibrant and engaging, capturing a moment of public discourse in a lively city setting.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with male speech, discussing RAND Corporation and its role in national security, noting it was "one of the very few nonprofit private corporations" working for this establishment. The speaker then references other organizations, noting they were "much closer associated" than RAND. Throughout the speech, there is consistent ambient noise suggesting a public outdoor setting. The speaker concludes, followed by a cut-off.

events_list.video_caption: In a bustling city park, an elderly man with white hair, dressed in a blue shirt, is being interviewed by a reporter holding a microphone and a recording device. The man appears to be sharing his thoughts or experiences, as he speaks and gestures with his hands. The reporter, wearing glasses and a dark shirt, listens attentively, occasionally glancing at his notes. In the background, other park-goers are seen walking, sitting, and enjoying the sunny day, with tall buildings and trees framing the lively urban setting. The atmosphere is vibrant, with people engaged in various activities, contributing to the dynamic environment of the park.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker mentioning "Booz Allen" as one of many corporations that handle sensitive data, noting that "70% of the intelligence budget goes to private contractors". He questions why he, as a "mid-level analyst" at Booz Allen, has access to information that invades privacy and is unavailable to Congress. Throughout the speech, there is consistent background ambiance with indistinct sounds, creating an environment.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, an older man with white hair, wearing a blue shirt, is being interviewed by a group of reporters in an outdoor urban setting. The reporters, including a woman with blonde hair wearing headphones and holding a microphone, are actively engaged in capturing his responses. The man appears to be speaking earnestly, with his mouth moving and his facial expressions changing as he communicates. The background features tall buildings, trees, and other people, suggesting a busy city environment. The atmosphere is lively, with the reporters focused on the interview and the man responding to their questions. The scene remains consistent throughout, with the man continuing to speak and the reporters attentively listening and recording his words.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker with a slightly exasperated tone discussing issues of access to classified information. He cites an experience of having access to a "7,000-page top secret study" that a senator couldn't get, and expresses his opinion that private contractors having such access is absurd and "smells of fascism." He also criticizes the blurred lines between corporations and the government. His tone is critical throughout. Background sounds of light wind rustling and the ambience of an outdoor environment are noticeable during the speech, adding a sense of realism to the recording.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, an older man with white hair, wearing a blue shirt, is being interviewed by a reporter holding a microphone and a piece of paper. The man appears to be speaking and gesturing with his hands while the reporter listens attentively. In the background, a woman with blonde hair wearing headphones and sunglasses is holding a microphone, possibly recording the interview. Another man with dark hair and glasses is also present, observing the interaction. The setting is an outdoor urban area with tall buildings, trees, and a crowd of people in the background, suggesting a public event or gathering. The atmosphere is lively, with people walking around and engaging in various activities. The video captures the dynamic interaction between the interviewee and the reporter, set against the backdrop of a bustling city environment.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker inquiring about the government not paying for court reporters in the Bradley Manning case. He states that funds were raised, and asks the interviewee how this was possible. The interviewee, also male, clarifies that they had to raise money for their own copy of the transcript, as copying cost a lot. Throughout the speech, there is noticeable ambient background noise.

events_list.video_caption: In a bustling city park, an elderly man with white hair, dressed in a blue shirt, is being interviewed by a reporter holding a microphone. The man appears to be sharing his thoughts or experiences, as he speaks and gestures with his hands. The reporter, wearing glasses and a dark shirt, listens attentively, occasionally glancing at his notes or the microphone. The background is lively, with people walking, sitting, and engaging in various activities, creating a vibrant atmosphere. Tall buildings loom in the distance, emphasizing the urban setting. The scene is well-lit, suggesting it is daytime, and the overall mood is one of casual interaction amidst the hustle and bustle of city life.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a single male speaker discussing a court case where the judge didn't provide a transcript, holding the trial "as closely as possible, as a closed trial." He mentions the Freedom of the Press Foundation crowdfunding money to hire a reporter with court capabilities to provide a transcript. This was needed, he says, as otherwise, they would rely on the scribbled notes of a few reporters. The speaker's tone is informative. The background sounds contain indiscernible ambient noise.

events_list.video_caption: In a bustling city park, an elderly man with white hair, dressed in a blue shirt, is being interviewed by a reporter holding a microphone. The man appears to be sharing his thoughts and experiences, occasionally smiling and gesturing with his hands. The reporter, wearing glasses and a dark shirt, listens attentively, occasionally glancing at his notes. In the background, other park-goers are seen walking, sitting, and engaging in various activities, contributing to the lively atmosphere. The scene is set against a backdrop of tall buildings, indicating an urban environment. The interaction between the man and the reporter is the focal point, capturing a moment of public engagement and storytelling amidst the vibrant city life.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker questioning, "On one hand, the government does not have the resources to monitor our federal court system", then skeptically inquires, "You're saying we have the resources to monitor every single communication across all the innocent civilians?". The speaker's tone appears inquisitive and somewhat challenging. A second male speaker then responds in a measured tone, stating it's "a matter of priorities" that "applies right across the board to human-". The clip abruptly ends mid-sentence.

events_list.video_caption: In a bustling city square, an elderly man with white hair, dressed in a blue shirt, is being interviewed by a reporter holding a microphone. The man appears to be sharing his thoughts or experiences, as he speaks animatedly and occasionally looks around. The background is filled with people walking, some carrying bags, and others wearing hats, indicating a busy urban environment. Trees and tall buildings frame the scene, adding to the lively atmosphere. The man's expressions and gestures suggest he is engaged in a meaningful conversation, possibly discussing a topic of personal significance or public interest. The overall setting conveys a sense of community and activity, with the interview taking place amidst the everyday hustle and bustle of city life.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features one male speaker with a critical and somewhat sarcastic tone. He discusses how "the government" seems to prioritize spending on things like "attack submarines" and "ABM systems" instead of infrastructure or healthcare. Interwoven with this speech is subtle, ambient background noise suggesting an outdoor public area.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, an older man with white hair, wearing a blue shirt, is being interviewed in a bustling city square. He is holding a white digital recorder in his left hand, while a person with glasses and a black shirt holds a smartphone in their right hand, presumably recording the interview. The man being interviewed appears to be speaking, as his mouth moves and his facial expressions change slightly throughout the video. The background is filled with people walking around, some carrying bags, and others wearing hats, indicating a busy urban environment. Tall buildings and trees are visible in the background, suggesting a downtown area. The atmosphere is lively, with people going about their day, and the interview seems to be taking place in a public space, possibly a park or plaza. The man being interviewed seems engaged in the conversation, occasionally looking to his left, possibly addressing someone off-camera or reacting to something in the environment. The video captures a moment of interaction in a vibrant city setting, with the interviewee actively participating in the discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker posing a question about Snowden and Bradley Manning, asking what advice the interviewee has for those working at the NSA or as defense contractors who witness injustice, considering their past experiences. A female speaker then starts to give her answer. Simultaneously, background ambiance is present, marked by medium-level vehicle noise.

events_list.video_caption: In a bustling city park, an elderly man with white hair, dressed in a blue shirt, is being interviewed by a reporter holding a microphone. The man appears to be sharing his thoughts or experiences, as he speaks animatedly. The reporter, wearing glasses and a white shirt, listens attentively, occasionally nodding in agreement. In the background, various people are seen walking, some carrying bags, and others engaged in conversation, contributing to the lively atmosphere of the park. The tall buildings surrounding the park add to the urban setting, creating a contrast between the natural greenery and the concrete structures. The scene captures a moment of interaction and exchange of ideas in a vibrant public space.
events_list.audio_caption: An adult male is speaking in an instructional tone, advising listeners to avoid his past mistakes, such as "go to Congress first" or "go to my superiors in the Defense Department." He suggests following the advice of others, to avoid being seen as "troublemakers and potential leakers" and facing retaliation. The speaker references NSA personnel who made similar errors. He notes that they "did it wrong."

events_list.video_caption: In the video, an elderly man with white hair, wearing a blue shirt, is being interviewed by a reporter holding a microphone. The man appears to be speaking, as his mouth is open in some frames, and he is gesturing with his hands. The reporter, who is wearing glasses and a black shirt, is attentively listening to the man. Another person, wearing an orange shirt and sunglasses, is holding a smartphone and a notepad, possibly taking notes or recording the interview. The background shows a busy urban environment with tall buildings, trees, and people walking around. The atmosphere seems lively, with various individuals going about their day. The man being interviewed seems engaged in the conversation, occasionally looking at the reporter and gesturing to emphasize his points. The video captures a moment of interaction between the interviewee and the reporter in a bustling city setting.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip opens with a male speaker asserting "Snowden did it right," continuing to elaborate on how to follow Snowden's example in handling sensitive information, cautioning against trusting government informants and advocating for maintaining anonymity. The speaker emphasizes, "do it like Snowden," praising his approach. The speaker's tone is instructional and somewhat emphatic. His voice is overlaid with a moderate level of ambient noise, suggesting a public or outdoor environment.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, an elderly man wearing a blue shirt is being interviewed by a reporter holding a microphone. The man appears to be speaking passionately, gesturing with his hands as he talks. The reporter, wearing glasses and a dark shirt, listens attentively, occasionally nodding in agreement. In the background, a young man in a pink shirt and sunglasses is holding a smartphone, possibly recording the interview. The setting is an urban park with tall buildings visible in the distance, and several people can be seen walking around, including a woman wearing a white hat and a shirt with the text "YES NO" printed on it. The atmosphere is lively, with the interview taking place in a public space surrounded by greenery and city life.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single male speaker discussing Edward Snowden's actions, mentioning mistakes like choosing Hong Kong and Russia, and suggesting Venezuela or Ecuador as alternatives. The speaker has a conversational tone. The background contains ambient noise, possibly indicating an outdoor setting.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, an elderly man with white hair, wearing a blue shirt, is being interviewed by a reporter holding a microphone. The man appears to be engaged in a serious conversation, occasionally looking to his left and right, possibly addressing different questions or people. The reporter, wearing glasses and a dark shirt, is attentively listening and gesturing with his hands, indicating an active dialogue. In the background, a bustling urban environment is visible, with tall buildings, trees, and several people walking around, including a person in a red shirt and another wearing a hat. The atmosphere suggests a public space, possibly a park or plaza, where the interview is taking place. The man being interviewed has a pen in his shirt pocket, and the reporter is holding a notepad, suggesting they are prepared for the discussion. The scene is well-lit, indicating it is daytime, and the overall mood is one of a typical outdoor interview in a busy city setting.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker posing a question regarding the millennial generation, mentioning "Daniel Ellsberg, Snowden, Zimmerman", and asking "why should they care?". This question is delivered in an inquisitive tone. The clip is predominantly speech-based.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, an elderly man with white hair, dressed in a blue shirt, is being interviewed by a reporter holding a microphone. The man appears to be speaking earnestly, with his mouth open and his gaze directed towards the reporter. The reporter, wearing glasses and a dark shirt, is attentively listening and holding a smartphone in his other hand. In the background, a woman wearing a white headscarf and a black shirt with the text "YES" and "NO" is visible, along with other people walking around. The setting is an urban area with tall buildings and trees, suggesting a public space or park. The atmosphere is casual and lively, with people going about their day. The video captures a moment of public discourse, with the elderly man sharing his thoughts or opinions on a topic of interest.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with speech from a single male speaker, who states, "Not because there is any guarantee that telling the truth will bring about change," followed by a summary of someone's fear that nothing would change, while also mentioning a chance for change and the high stakes involved. He continues, emphasizing that humanity and democracy are on the line. All the while, ambient background sounds of a city street are present.

events_list.video_caption: In a bustling city square, an elderly man with white hair, dressed in a blue shirt, is being interviewed by a man holding a microphone. The elderly man gestures animatedly with his hands as he speaks, while the interviewer listens attentively. In the background, a woman wearing a white headscarf and a shirt with the word "YES" printed on it stands nearby, observing the conversation. The cityscape behind them features tall buildings and trees, creating a lively urban atmosphere. The scene captures a moment of public discourse, with the elderly man passionately sharing his thoughts amidst the hustle and bustle of the city.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker, discussing Snowden's revelations about global interference with citizens' privacy, noting that the US has far greater capabilities, but other countries are catching up. His tone is serious and somewhat resigned, suggesting the difficulty of changing this reality. He reflects on the new world order and the uncertainty of altering it. His words are followed by silence.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, an older man with white hair, wearing a blue shirt, is being interviewed by a man with dark hair and glasses, who is holding a microphone. The interview takes place in a bustling city square, with tall buildings and trees in the background. The older man speaks animatedly, using hand gestures to emphasize his points. Behind them, a woman wearing a white headband and a shirt with the word "YES" printed on it is visible, along with other people walking around. The atmosphere is lively, with the interviewee appearing engaged and expressive as he shares his thoughts.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker discussing the importance of truth and taking risks, while being careful not to endanger others. His tone is thoughtful. He suggests that those who know the truth is being concealed should speak out in a way that attracts attention and protects them from retaliation. He concludes with a thank you, acknowledging the speaker's lifetime of activism. The clip ends.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with an outdoor interview in a bustling city square, where an older man in a blue shirt is being interviewed by a younger man wearing glasses and a dark shirt with a white collar. The interviewer holds a digital recorder, capturing the conversation. The background is lively, with people walking around, trees, and tall buildings, creating a vibrant urban atmosphere. The scene then transitions to a black screen displaying the text "BizCloud®" in blue, which remains on the screen for several frames, indicating a possible branding or title sequence. The video concludes with a return to a black screen, suggesting the end of the segment or a pause before the next scene.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with speech, where a male speaker says, "It's a great pleasure and honor to see you." He is followed by a different male speaker replying, "Thank you." There is speech in the background as well.
